# DEVELOPMENT OF AN EFFECTIVE mRNA-BASED AFRICAN SWINE FEVER VACCINE

## Canada Tender Announcement 

### Solicitation Number: 39903-230304/A
#### Publication Date: 2022-10-18
#### Tender Closing Date: 2022-11-09T16:00:00

**Request for Proposal | Demande de propositions**

Public Works and Government Services Canada is seeking proposals for the development of an effective mRNA-based African Swine Fever (ASF) vaccine that can differentiate vaccinated from infected animals.

**Background:**

African Swine Fever (ASF) is a highly fatal, hemorrhagic viral disease affecting members of the Suidae family. Currently, there is no commercially effective vaccine or treatment for ASF. This presents significant risks for swine industry in ASF-free countries due to high mortality and trade restrictions.

**Objective:**

The successful bidder will design, produce and supply mRNA vaccines to the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) at the National Centre for Foreign Animal disease (NCFAD) in Winnipeg, Canada. The project aims to develop a vaccine that can differentiate vaccinated from infected animals.

**Scope of Work:**

*   Design, produce, and supply mRNA vaccines to CFIA at NCFAD
*   Test the vaccine in vaccination-challenge experiments at NCFAD
*   Deliver a minimum of 80% of goods and/or services of Canadian origin

**Evaluation and Selection Criteria:**

Mandatory technical evaluation criteria are included in Annex C of the solicitation. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award of a contract.

**Intellectual Property:**

Any intellectual property arising from the performance of the work under the Contract will vest in Canada.

**Contract Period:**

The anticipated contract period is from the date of award to December 31, 2023.
